configuration.description: Enter the object store JDBC data source settings. Content Platform Engine uses these settings to connect to the object store database.
configuration.displayName: Configure Object Store JDBC Data Sources

property.name: JDBCDataSourceName
property.description: The JNDI name of the JDBC data source for the global configuration database or object store database or table space. The name must be unique, for example, FNGCDDS or FNOS1DS. The default name is {0}. If the data source already exists, you must manually remove it by using your application server administration tools, and then create the data source here.

property.name: JDBCDataSourceXAName
property.description: The JNDI name of the XA data source for the global configuration database or object store database or table space. The name must be unique, for example, FNGCDDSXA or FNOS1DSXA. The default name is {0}. If the data source already exists, you must manually remove it by using your application server administration tools, and then create the data source here.

property.name: DatabaseServerName
property.description: The host name of the server where the database software is installed.

property.name: DatabasePortNumber
property.description: The port number that is used by the DB2 database instance in which you create table spaces for the global configuration database and object stores. The default DB2 port is 50000.

property.name: DatabaseName
property.description: The name of the global configuration database or object store database. See your database documentation for naming restrictions.

property.name: DatabaseUsername
property.description: The database user name that you defined as the cpe_db_user in the FileNet P8 Information Center topic "Creating the Content Platform Engine user account for DB2 for Linux, UNIX and Windows" to access the global configuration database or object store table space.

property.name: JDBCDriverVersion
property.description: Enter the JDBC driver version for your database type. Valid values are: 3.0 / 4.0

property.name: Script
property.description: Enter the script to use to accomplish a particular configuration task.

property.name: tempDir
property.description: The absolute path to a temporary directory to be used by the configuration task, for example, c:\Program Files\IBM\FileNet\ContentEngine\tools\configure\tmp.

property.name: DBFailoverEnabled
property.description: This setting specifies whether database failover support is enabled or disabled. When set to true, database failover support is enabled. When set to false, database failover support is disabled.
